inclusion.criterion: Newly diagnosed initial episodes of pulmonary tuberculosis
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Sputum smear-positive and -negative patients are eligible for enrollment
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: The diagnosis of tuberculosis must be confirmed by culture
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Chest X-ray and clinical findings consistent with tuberculosis
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Hemoglobin greater than or equal to 8 gm/dL (greater than or equal to 5.0 mmol/L)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Serum aspartate aminotransferase (AST) < 1.5 times the upper limit of normal for the testing laboratory
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Random serum glucose less than or equal to 150 mg/dl (8.3 mmol/L)
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Willing to provide informed consent for study participation, provide required specimens for examination, and to undergo and receive results of human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) testing
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Willing to receive supervised anti-TB treatment
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Completion of the required 112 doses of chemotherapy within 18 weeks of starting treatment
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: History of prior tuberculosis or history of previous tuberculosis treatment
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Cavitary tuberculosis on initial chest X-ray (taken within 14 days of study entry)
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: Exposure to person(s) with known drug resistant tuberculosis
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Patients receiving chronic steroids or other immunosuppressive medications
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Patients with drug resistant tuberculosis (resistance to isoniazid (INH), rifampicin, pyrazinamide or ethambutol)
exclusion.label: triggers

notes: Patient has newly diagnosed initial episodes of pulmonary tuberculosis with confirmed diagnosis by culture. Chest X-ray and clinical findings are consistent with tuberculosis. Patient is ambulatory and willing to receive supervised anti-TB treatment.
